text: "FDT" ("Fuck Donald Trump"") is the second single off of American rapper YG's second studio album Still Brazy. The song was released on March 30, 2016. The song also features American rapper Nipsey Hussle. The song was able to make it to #10 on the Bubbling Under Hot 100 Singles and #50 on the Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Songs charts. The song was certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). The song is a protest song against President Donald Trump. At that time Trump was a presidential candidate. The song was made in less than an hour. YG said that he made the song after seeing Hussle's connection and work with Mexican immigrants and Nipsey said he was angry about Trump's views on Hispanic people and immigration. YG said that the United States Secret Service tried to stop his album's release. When Joe Biden defeated Donald Trump in the 2020 United States presidential election, the song was able to reach #1 on the iTunes music charts. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:2016 songs Category:Hip hop songs Category:Protest songs
title: FDT (song)
